author: epheph
content: What i found from running a node with ramdisk was that it didn't keep in sync better, or process blocks that much faster. The vast majority of state being executed is likely very warm in a variety of caches (both geth and Linux's fscache). However, what we DID find was that when simulating all transactions found on the wire, the distribution of time it took to simulate those transactions became MUCH more consistent than nodes that are backed by disk

author: epheph
content: I had histogram of simulation time, the non-ramdisk nodes would have these massive outliers at like 100ms and beyond. the ramdisk node's histogram kept everything neatly packed in much, much smaller timeframe

author: epheph
content: i can't remember exactly the times, but i remember the shape of that chart.
